topic: Biodegradable plastic alternatives from agricultural waste
context: Current plastics take 500+ years to decompose. Agricultural waste (corn husks, rice straw) is abundant but underutilized. Bio-based plastics exist but are expensive.
objective: Design biodegradable polymer from agricultural waste with mechanical properties similar to HDPE and <2 year decomposition time
key_papers: PLA (polylactic acid) from corn starch - biodegradable but low strength
PHB (polyhydroxybutyrate) from bacteria - strong but expensive
Cellulose nanofibers from wood - strong but difficult processing

context: Current antibody discovery takes 2-5 years. Cancer cells express unique surface markers (neoantigens). Need antibodies that bind specifically to cancer cells.
objective: Design antibody with high affinity (Kd < 1 nM) to specific cancer neoantigen and minimal off-target binding
key_papers: CAR-T cell therapy - uses engineered T cells, not antibodies

context: Green hydrogen requires freshwater electrolysis. Freshwater is scarce in many regions. Seawater is abundant but contains corrosive chlorides that damage electrodes.
objective: Design electrocatalyst that splits seawater with >80% efficiency, resistant to chloride corrosion for >1000 hours
key_papers: Platinum catalysts - high efficiency but expensive and corrode
NiFe layered double hydroxides - cheap but low seawater stability
Transition metal nitrides - moderate efficiency, better corrosion resistance

context: Current quantum computers require cooling to millikelvin temperatures (expensive, bulky). Some materials show quantum effects at higher temperatures. Need materials that maintain quantum coherence at room temperature.
objective: Predict materials with quantum coherence times >1 millisecond at 300K
key_papers: Nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond - T2 ~2ms at 300K, but low density
Topological qubits - theoretical, not yet demonstrated at 300K
